newsitem.title: POLAND: Czech Rep lowest investment risk in E.Europe -poll.
newsitem.headline: Czech Rep lowest investment risk in E.Europe -poll.

text.p: Investment risk in 14 east and central European countries is lowest in the Czech Republic, with Poland second and Hungary third, a survey conducted every six months by an independent Polish research institute said.

The Gdansk-based Research Institute for Market Economy (IBnGR) for the first time did not include East Germany in its survey, which six months ago led the ranking followed by the Czech Republic, Hungary and Poland. @

"The Czech Republic is becoming the region's leader as the investment risk there is clearly falling down, but the distance between Poland and Czech Republic is narrowing," an analyst at the IBnGR, Zbigniew Dworzecki, told a news conference.
He said the whole Eastern and Central European region was becoming safer and more attractive for foreign investment as its countries had improved their legal systems and economic situation.
